choices.text: Years lost due to premature death.
Years lost to poor quality of life.

questions.text: The years of potential life lost could be attributed to?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Years lost due to premature death

Explanation

•    DALY is disability adjusted life years. 

•    DALY refers to YLL + YLD (Years of life lost due to premature death/ potential life lost + Years of life lost due to disability).

questions.text: Global Hunger Index which of the following is not a part of it?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

IMR


Explanation

questions.text: 2 doctors were asked to report 100 X- rays and Kappa value 0.71; what is interpretation?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Good


Explanation

questions.text: Longitudinal Observational/ follow up and Analytical Study is:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Cohort

Explanation

questions.text: 30,000 people were followed for period of 30 years. At the end of the 30 years; 1200 people were found to be diseases. From those who were non diseased; equal number of controls were assigned at end. Type of study design is:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Case cohort

Explanation

Advanced Cohort Study: Case Control Studies Based in A defined Cohort

•    Predominantly a type of cohort study (due to a forward direction)

•    Advantages:

•    Problem of recall bias is eliminated

•    Advantage of temporality is maintained

•    Economical (Done for rare diseases + whose diagnostic tests are very expensive)

•    Greater comparability (as both cases & controls are derived from the original cohort)

•    Disadvantage: non diseased persons from whom the controls are selected may not be fully representative of original cohort, due to death or failure to follow up cases

•    Types of Advanced Cohorts:

questions.text: Which of the following is not correctly matched?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Diagnostic studies: CONSORT


Explanation


Checklist for Epidemiological Studies

questions.text: Research is being conducted to find the association between aniline dye exposure and bladder cancer in workers of an industry who have worked for > 20 years. 2 groups were formed; one directly involved in dye handling and other group consisted of office clerks not directly exposed to the dye. Years of occupation was noted from previous records. What type of study is being performed?

Key WORD: RECORD

choices.text: Isolate for 6 days after giving acyclovir followed by VZIg within 72 hours of exposure.
Isolate for 12 days after giving acyclovir followed by VZIg within 48 hours of exposure.
Only give VZIg to all contacts

questions.text: A boy’s hostel has an outbreak of fever cases with headache followed by the development of pleomorphic rashes sparing palms and soles. What is the next best step in management in suspected cases?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Only isolate for 6 days 

Explanation

VZIg: 

•    Within 72 hours (OPTION B is excluded)

•    Given to all susceptible individuals for people who are immunocompromised (NOT GIVEN IN ALL) (OPTION A & D is excluded)

Role of Acyclovir:

•    Mainly given in adults (not given in children) (OPTION A is excluded)

Role of OKA vaccine:

•    Given to children 

•    Given to all

•    Within 5 days of exposure

questions.text: A patient visits a TB clinic; according to NTEP what is the next step for a patient with sputum negative; but chest X ray showing signs of TB?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

CBNAAT

Explanation

Now we don’t go for repeat SS.

choices.text: Immunoglobulin and full course of vaccine

questions.text: A young male has a clean wound without any bleeding. The patient received full course of tetanus vaccination 10 years ago. What is the best management of the patient?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Single dose of Tetanus vaccine

questions.text: A 10-year-old child (class 5) should be given which of the following vaccines?

Td vaccine

Explanation

Td vaccine 2 dose booster is given at 10th and 16th year of age.

questions.text:
Which of the following vaccines can be given in pregnancy?

1. COVID vaccine

2. Measles, Mumps, Rubella vaccine

3. Hepatitis B vaccine

4. Rabies vaccine
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

1, 3 and 4

Explanation

All LA vaccines are C/I in pregnancy except rabies (in case of bite); Yellow fever, cholera and OPV (Outbreak and travel) and COVID vaccines.

questions.text:
Consider the following vaccines:

1. BCG Vaccine

2. Hepatitis B Vaccine

3. Inactivated Polio Vaccine (IPV)

4. Oral Polio Vaccine (OPV)

What is the correct order of the above vaccines as per their sensitivity to heat (most sensitive to least sensitive) given in the National Immunization Schedule (NIS)?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

4→3→1→2

Explanation

1. Hepatitis A vaccine

2. Hepatitis B vaccine

4. Human papilloma virus vaccine

Correct Answer (C)

2 & 4

Hep B: Hepatocellular cancer

HPV: Cervical cancer

questions.text:
What is the correct increasing order of minimum age at which the following vaccine, are administered to a child, as part of the National Immunization Schedule (NIS) after birth of child? 

1. BCG vaccine 

2. Japanese Encephalitis (JE) vaccine 

3. Rotavirus vaccine 

4. Tetanus and adult diphtheria (Td) vaccine
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

1 → 3→2→ 4

Explanation6/6/2024

questions.text:
Which among the following is correct about yellow fever vaccination requirement for international travelers? 

1. Term of validity of the certificate is changed from 10 years to the duration of the life of the vaccinated person, some years ago. 

2. Lifetime validity of the certificate applies automatically to all existing and new certificates. 

3. Validity of the certificate begins 4 days after vaccination. 

4. In India, booster dose of yellow fever vaccine is required for those whose certificate is prior to the year 2016.
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

1 & 2

Explanation

International certificate of vaccination

•    All including infants (including those in transit)

•    If no certificate: Vaccine given & kept for 6 days (IP = 3- 6 days) from in a mosquito proof ward.

•    If traveller arrives before certificate becomes valid (10 days after vaccination): kept in mosquito free ward till it becomes valid.

questions.text:
Regarding active immunization against Typhoid fever, consider the following statements: 

1. The typhoid polysaccharide vaccine is injectable and can be given subcutaneously or intramuscularly. 

2. The typhoid polysaccharide vaccine is required to be given in two doses and administered on 0 and 7th day. 

3. The typhoid oral Ty2la vaccine requires to be given in three doses on 0, 3rd and 7th days. 

4. Protective immunity with typhoid vaccines is achieved immediately after the vaccine is received.
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

1 only 

Explanation

Statement 1: Polysaccharide vaccine has single human dose. 

Statement 3: Typhoral (Live oral Ty21a)

–     Contains > 109 viable organisms of attenuated S Typhi

–      Principle of 3 – 3 doses – on day 1, 3, and 5, once every 3 years, protection for 3 years

Statement 4: Immunity doesn’t develop immediately and that is why it is not given post disaster to victims.

choices.text: Abscess at injection site after DPT vaccine

questions.text: The event related to vaccination which can be contraindication for the next vaccination of similar/ identical type is
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Encephalopathy following DPT vaccine.

Explanation

Encephalopathy following DPT is an absolute C/I for further doses.

questions.text:
Which of the following events could be caused or precipitated by an active component of vaccine?

1.    Anaphylaxis after measles vaccine

2.    Encephalopathy after DPT vaccine

3.    Adenitis following BCG vaccine.

4.    Gastroenteritis following MMR vaccine.
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

1,2 & 3

Explanation 

•    Anaphylaxis although rare can be caused by measles vaccine.

•    Encephalopathy due to pertussis

•    Lymphadenitis is also rare but associated with BCG.

•    Gastroenteritis is not associated with measles, mumps, or rubella.

questions.text: Vaccine-associated poliomyelitis (VAPP) chiefly seen with which of the following strains of oral poliovirus?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Explanation

questions.text: In which one of the following diseases are the source of infection and reservoir of infection the same?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Tetanus

Explanation

Reservoir and source of infection may or may not be similar, similar in majority (In tetanus they are similar (soil)

•    Hookworm:

–    Reservoir: Man

–    Source: Soil

•    S typhi:

–    Reservoir: GB of infected individual

–    Source: Food contaminated by carrier

questions.text: In which one of the following vector-borne diseases, the transmission chain is 'Man-Snail-Man'?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Schistosomiasis

Explanation

questions.text: Which one among the following is best defined as the interval of time between receipt of infection by a host and maximal infectivity of that host?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Generation Time

Explanation

•    Serial interval: 

–    the gap in time between onset of primary & secondary cases 

•    Infectious (communicable) period: 

–    length of time a person can transmit disease.

•    Incubation period: E --------- → Development of disease. 

•    Latent period: E--------- → Onset of infectiousness 

–    may be shorter or longer than the incubation period.

•    Generation time: E ----------- → Maximal infectivity of the host

•    Window Period: E----- → Lab detection of disease

questions.text: BP of people was tracked from childhood to adulthood. It was observed that those who had lower BP in childhood had low BP in adulthood, while those who had higher in childhood had high BP in adulthood. This can be best described as:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Tracking Phenomenon

Explanation

questions.text: What significant error did the intern make while creating a banner on measures to prevent the spread of NCDs, as assigned by a group of doctors?

Shift from PUFA to TRANSFAT

questions.text: Screening for Cervical Cancer at SC and PHC level:

VIA

Cervical Cancer Prevention

–    Once a woman is screened to be HPV negative, she should not undergo re- screening in between 3 to 5 years

questions.text: Rukmini is attending Village Nutrition and Sanitation Day. How frequently it is conducted?

questions.text: The expected outcome of Government of India's initiative `SUMAN' is:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Zero preventable maternal and newborn deaths

SUMAN program is for addressing the existing inequities in maternal and newborn health care services and move towards zero preventable maternal and newborn deaths.

questions.text:
Under the National Leprosy Eradication Program, ASHAs have been entrusted to carry out which of the following activities? 

1. ASHAs are to search for suspected cases of leprosy in their villages and take them to the PHCs for diagnosis and treatment. 

2. ASHAs arrange an amount of 5,000 as an incentive to each leprosy affected person in their village for undergoing reconstructive surgery. 

3. ASHAs ensure that each leprosy affected person in their village receives micro-cellular rubber footwear for protection of insensitive feet. 

4. ASHAs follow up all confirmed cases of leprosy in their village to ensure their treatment is completed.
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

1 & 4

Explanation

All the 4 activities are conducted by ASHA workers, but she receives incentives only for activity 1 & 4.

questions.text:
NACO (National AIDS Control Organization) in India works towards which of the following causes? 

1. Screening high risk cases of HIV 

2. Facilitating adoption of orphans 

3. Public education towards safe sex 

4. Treating HIV cases free of cost
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

1,3 & 4

Explanation

By common sense by reading the options

questions.text:
In the National Health Policy 2017, a target of 90: 90: 90 has been set for HIV/AIDS. Which among the following are targets for which a 90% level has been set as part of 90: 90: 90 for HIV/AIDS? 

1. Proportion of couples who have safe sex 

2. Proportion of people living with HIV who know their HIV status 

3. Proportion of adolescents who have access to contraceptives 

4. Proportion of people receiving antiretroviral therapy who have viral suppression
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

2 & 4

Explanation

National Strategic Plan (NSP) for HIV/ AIDS & STI, 2017- 24

•    Vision: Paving the way for an AIDS free India

•    Goal: 0 new infections; 0 AIDS related deaths; 0 discrimination

•    Targets by 2020:

–    75% reduction in new HIV infections

–    90- 90- 90: 90% of those who are HIV positive in country know their status; 90% who know their status are on treatment & 90% those who are on treatment are on effective viral load suppression

–    Elimination of parent to child transmission of HIV & syphilis

–    Elimination of stigma & discrimination

questions.text: The Sample Registration System (SRS), an important source of health information, consists of continuous enumeration of births and deaths by an enumerator and an independent survey every six months by an investigator-supervisor. Which one of the following terms best describes this system?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Dual record system

Explanation

Sample Registration System

Dual record system:

•    Field investigation: continuous enumeration of births & deaths by enumerator

•    Independent retrospective survey: every 6 months by a supervisor

•    Advantages:

–    Elimination of errors of duplication

–    Self-evaluating technique

questions.text: 2 stages of demographic cycle with same high birth rate but death rate is variable. These stages are:

questions.text:
To reduce the risk of neural tube defects in the baby, which of the following are recommended?

A.    Folate supplements, from month before conception to three months after

B.    Folate supplements, from confirmation of pregnancy to the end of first trimester

C.    Zinc supplements, from one month before conception to three months after

D.    Zinc supplements, from confirmation of pregnancy to the end of first trimester
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

1,2 & 3

Explanation

Importantly, zinc-only, or zinc-containing multiple micronutrient supplementation can decrease the risk of NTDs in humans.

questions.text: The best indicator of status in terms of availability and utilization of health care of a country is:

IMR

questions.text:
Which of the following correctly represents the three critical determinants of a healthy facility being declared as a First Referral Unit (FRU)? 

1. Availability of emergency obstetric surgical interventions 

2. Availability of immunization services 

3. Blood storage facility 

4. Newborn care

3 critical determinants:

•    Newborn care

questions.text: The daily average dietary nutrient intake level sufficient to meet the nutrient requirement of nearly all (97- 98%) healthy individuals in a particular life stage and gender group is knows as:

Correct Answer (A)

RDA

Explanation

Recommended Dietary Allowance (RDA):

•    97.5% population

•    RDA is not used for energy (excess energy intake will lead to obesity)
Estimated Average Requirement (EAR): 50% amount of a nutrient estimated to be adequate for half of the healthy individuals of a specific age and sex

questions.text: What type of sanitation facilities should be provided for the refugees/ soldiers returning from War?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Trench latrine

Explanation

Trench Latrine is only recommended for the immediate emergency response.

An aqua privy is a tank filled with water into which excreta falls via a drop pipe. It uses a water seal to prevent odours getting out of the tank and a soak-away pit to dispose of sullage and effluent. The drop pipe in the tank extends below the surface of the water to prevent the escape of odours.

Pit latrines collect human faeces in a hole in the ground. The principle of a pit latrine is that all liquids that enter the pit – in particular urine and water used for anal cleansing – seep into the ground.

questions.text:

questions.solution:

3 & 4 only

Explanation

questions.solution:

Scrub typhus

Vector and Disease Transmitted

questions.text: Reservoir of Leishmaniasis in India?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Human

Explanation

Humans are the only reservoir host in this region for the parasite causing the disease. The only way the disease spreads from human to human is by one insect in the region, Phlebotomus argentipes.

questions.text:
Which of the following mosquito-borne diseases are transmitted chiefly by Aedes mosquito?

1. Dengue

2. West Nile fever

3. Yellow fever

4. Zika fever
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

1,3 & 4 only

Explanation

questions.text:
Consider the following statements about correlation between two variables: 

1. The correlation is done between an independent variable X and a dependent variable Y. 

2. The coefficient of correlation can range from-1to∝. 

3. If coefficient of correlation (r) is equal to 1, it indicates there is no association between X and Y. 

4. Correlation does not necessarily prove causation.
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

1 & 4 only

Explanation

Option 2: Correlation coefficient ranges from – 1 to + 1

Option 3: If the correlation coefficient is 1; it means there is perfectly positive relationship.

questions.text: This formula is used to calculate:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Standard Deviation 

Explanation 

This formula is for SD; SD is referred as root mean square deviation. If sample size if less than 30 then denominator is ‘n-1’ and if more than 30 than ‘n’.

questions.text: Mean +-1 SD corresponds to:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

68.3%

Explanation 

•    68%: 1 SD

•    90%: 1.645 SD

•    95%: 2 SD

•    99%: 3 SD

choices.text: Arithmetic mean is affected by extreme values.
Mode is most affected by extreme values.
Median is calculated by overall observation.
Mode can be used as qualitative data descriptor.

questions.text: All the following statement are true for central tendency except:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Mode is most affected by extreme values.

Explanation

Outliers: Extreme values

•    Calculate the median

•    Most affected: Mean

•    Least affected: Mode

•    We apply the Q test

questions.text: All the following maybe used to find the normalcy of data except:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Mantel- Haenszel Test

Explanation

Miscellaneous Statistical Tests:

The Mantel Haenszel test is used for sample sets that are able to be placed in two-by-two tables, but unlike the Fisher Exact test and the chi-squared test, there is no “n” requirement. The test can be used to verify samples with an n as small as two data, or a large n with over 5000 participants. It is used for STRATIFICATION to separate confounder and effect modifier.

questions.text: In Kaplan Meier survival curve, bands used for confidence interval is:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Hall Wellner Band

Explanation

Kaplan-Meier estimator of S(t) together with 95% pointwise confidence intervals and 95% Hall-Wellner confidence bounds. (Most common bands)

The others are Gill and Nair Bands.

questions.solution:

Cobalt therapy units

Colombo Plan

•    1950 

•    Economic development on cooperative basis 

•    Industrial development 

•    Agricultural development

•    Health promotion

•    with help of New Zealand + Canada

•    Cobalt therapy units were installed in medical colleges

questions.text: A researcher is investigating the association between smoking and lung cancer. She recruits 500 participants, including 250 individuals diagnosed with lung cancer and 250 individuals without lung cancer, and collects data on their smoking habits. Which study design is being used in this scenario?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Case-control study

Explanation: 

In a case-control study, participants are selected based on whether they have the outcome of interest (cases) or not (controls). The researcher compares the exposure (smoking habits) between cases (individuals with lung cancer) and controls (individuals without lung cancer) to assess the association between smoking and lung cancer.
